summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident and accompanying Incident Report detailing the events of July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM, when inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell with a homemade noose around his neck. The report documents the suicide attempt, the response by staff, and the subsequent disciplinary process for the prohibited act of self-mutilation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the incident report. Found in his SHU cell with a homemade noose around his neck, breathing heavily and unresponsive. He was placed on suicide watch and later charged with the prohibited act of self-mutilation.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in SHU cell 124. He was at the cell door alerting staff that Epstein had attempted to hang himself. He was secured and removed from the cell during the response.

persons.name: Skipper-Sott, S.
persons.context: Staff member who submitted the Form 583 Report of Incident. The report is approved by this individual.

persons.name: Silva
persons.context: Staff officer who, along with the reporting employee, heard noise from the cell, grabbed door keys, and called for assistance during the incident.

persons.name: Masullo, J.
persons.context: Staff member who typed and signed the initial Incident Report (Part I), describing the discovery of Epstein and the response.

connections.description: Were housed together in SHU cell 124 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Tartaglione alerted staff to Epstein's condition.
Masullo was the reporting staff member who discovered Epstein, placed him on his side, and removed the noose during the incident response.
Silva was the staff officer who assisted in responding to the incident, securing keys and calling for help.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt in SHU
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell lying in a fetal position with a homemade orange rope noose around his neck. He was breathing heavily but unresponsive. Staff removed the noose, restrained him, and transported him to medical for examination, where he was found to have neck erythema and friction marks. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Disciplinary Investigation Interview
events.description: An investigator advised Epstein of his rights regarding the self-mutilation charge. Epstein stated "I no comment at this time" and was noted to have a poor attitude. The investigation concluded the incident report was accurate and the charge warranted.

events.title: Unit Discipline Committee (UDC) Action
events.description: The UDC found Epstein had committed the prohibited act of self-mutilation (Code 228) and referred the charge to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) for further hearing.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell at approximately 1:27 AM on July 23, 2019, with a homemade orange rope noose around his neck, in an apparent suicide attempt.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, was the one who alerted staff to the situation by stating Epstein "had attempted to hang himself."
Staff observed Epstein flickering his eyes and shutting them hurriedly when staff made eye contact, suggesting a level of consciousness during the response.
Epstein was charged with the prohibited act of self-mutilation (Code 228) and the case was referred for a disciplinary hearing.
The incident report was served late because Epstein was on suicide watch following the event.
